abstract.p: AdZone Interactive says Internet ad spending rebounded in September; says despite overall increase among all online spenders, 10 heaviest-spending brands collectively cut ad outlays by 8.6 percent; graph (S)

block.p: Internet ad spending rebounded in September, according to AdZone Interactive, an advertising research firm that tracks advertising on 1,300 Web sites accounting for more than 95 percent of all United States Internet advertising revenue. Despite an overall increase among all online spenders, the 10 heaviest-spending brands collectively cut ad outlays by 8.6 percent. Sears .com, one of the few among the top 10 to increase spending from August, was No. 1 for September. John Cardona, president at AdZone Interactive in New York, said, ''After last month's correction, it seems advertising on the Web is back to continuing its steady rise.''
